description: lyo- (“solvent, dispersion”) +‎ -phobic (“having aversion to”), from Ancient Greek λύω (lúō, “to loosen, to dissolve”) + φόβος (phóbos, “fear”) + Latin -icus.

adjectives.description: lyophobic (comparative more lyophobic, superlative most lyophobic)

entries.meaning: (chemistry, of a colloid) Having no affinity for the dispersion medium and thus easily precipitated.
